[b]La publicaciÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³n del libro La Biblia desenterrada, del director del Instituto de ArqueologÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­a de la Universidad de Tel-Aviv Israel Finkelstein y del periodista judÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­o Neil Aher Silberman, ha sacudido el panorama cultural de Israel. Los autores sostienen que algunos de las temas mÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¡s conocidos del Antiguo Testamento son ahistÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³ricos y tenÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­an como objetivo legitimar las aspiraciones del reino de JudÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¡. Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¿La Historia y la ArqueologÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­a desmienten a la Biblia? En estos 4 DVDs se irÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¡n viendo algunas de las cuestiones planteadas.[/b]

[b][i]THE BIBLE UNEARTHED shows how the efforts of contemporary archaeologists are helping us to understand the stories of the Bible in their political, geographical, historical and cultural contexts. This four-part series thus does something which has never been done before. It reveals a still-unraveling revolution of what we know of the society, the history, and the men who wrote the Bible.[/i][/b]

[size=4][color=blue][b]I. LOS PATRIARCAS | THE PATRIARCHS[/b][/color][/size]

[img]http://img88.imageshack.us/img88/5263/desenterrariey5.jpg[/img]

[b]EspaÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â±ol:[/b] El Antiguo Testamento es el nombre con que se conoce la ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œBiblia HebreaÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½, y es una obra histÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³rica indispensable para conocer muchos de los yacimientos arqueolÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³gicos de Oriente PrÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³ximo. Las excavaciones mÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¡s relevantes se llevan a cabo en la regiÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³n de Megiddo, un enclave estratÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©gico que en la antigÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¼edad unÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­a comercialmente a Egipto y Mesopotamia. 
En la actualidad, Megiddo es el yacimiento mÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¡s importante para la arqueologÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­a bÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­blica. Historiadores y arqueÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³logos trabajan conjuntamente para demostrar la naturaleza histÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³rica de los Patriarcas del judaÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­smo: Abraham, Isaac y Jacob.

[b]English:[/b][i] Dawn breaks on the land of Canaan. A land in which, according to the Bible, the Patriarchs lived: Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. In Megiddo and other archeological sites of the Levant, the investigation begins. How has archaeology dealt with the great biblical accounts in the past? What does it tell us today about Abraham, his son, and his grandson? Did they really exist? In what period? Why did the authors of this account as recorded in Genesis tell their tale in this way? The film ends with the destiny of the Bible&#039;s patriarchal figures: offering the people who wrote these texts a family, a genealogy. The first "pillar" of what was to become Judaism.[/i]


[size=4][color=blue][b]II. EL ÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬Â°XODO | THE EXODUS[/b][/color][/size]

[img]http://img512.imageshack.us/img512/8123/desenterrarivpz3.jpg[/img]

[b]EspaÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â±ol:[/b] La Biblia explica que los descendientes de los Patriarcas fueron a vivir a Egipto, donde se quedaron cuatrocientos treinta aÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â±os. La historia de su liberaciÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³n de la mano de MoisÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©s y de su viaje por el desierto se explica en el segundo libro de la Biblia: el ÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬Â°xodo.
Para entender el papel que juega Egipto en la Biblia hebrea debemos remontarnos a las circunstancias que rodearon a la llegada de los hijos de Jacob a ese paÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­s. Las ÃƒÆ’Ã‚Âºltimas investigaciones de los arqueÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³logos e historiadores nos muestran en este capÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­tulo la epopeya de los antiguos israelitas ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“con MoisÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©s a la cabezaÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ por alcanzar la Tierra Prometida.

[b]English:[/b][i] The archeological and historical investigation continues in Egypt where, according to the Bible, the descendants of Abraham, including Joseph and Moses, once settled. Moses set the Hebrews free from slavery before leading them on an Exodus to the Promised Land. Did this episode of the Old Testament actually happen? When and why was it written? What do we know of the kingdom of Juda and King Josias? What part did Josias play in the writing of the Book of the Covenant and of these Laws which were to become the second "pillar" of Judaism?[/i]


[size=4][color=blue][b]III. LOS REYES | THE KINGS[/b][/color][/size]

[img]http://img411.imageshack.us/img411/756/desenterrariivl3.jpg[/img]

[b]EspaÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â±ol:[/b] La conquista de Canaan, seguida de su divisiÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³n, son la base del libro de JosuÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©. CiÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â±ÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©ndonos a la cronologÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­a bÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­blica, este incidente tuvo lugar en la segunda mitad del s. XIII antes de Cristo. Los arqueÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³logos han localizado la mayorÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­a de las ciudades que aparecen mencionadas en ese periodo en el texto bÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­blico.
El yacimiento mÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¡s importante es Hazor, en Galilea. Las excavaciones realizadas han puesto al descubierto lo que debÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­a ser un gran palacio y un templo, destruidos ambos por un violento incendio. Este es sÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³lo el inicio de una bÃƒÆ’Ã‚Âºsqueda apasionante.

[b]English:[/b][i] This episode brings back to life the history of the Israelite nation in Canaan as told in the Bible: Moses entrusted the conquest of Canaan to Joshua. During a lightning war, a confederation of Israelite tribes took possession of Canaan and settled there. The archeological investigation is at variance with this account. This episode then takes a closer look at Kings David and Solomon. What do we actually know about them? And what of the two Israelite kingdoms situated on the territory of Canaan: Israel to the north, rich and powerful, and Juda, to the south, small and poor. What role will the antagonism between these two &#039;friendly&#039; kingdoms play in the writing of the Bible? What is the King of Juda, Josias&#039;s ambition after the destruction of the kingdom of Israel to the north? How does the death of Josias, a descendant of King David, bring about the emergence of the third "pillar" of Judaism: the Messianic idea?[/i]


[size=4][color=blue][b]IV. EL LIBRO SAGRADO | THE BOOK[/b][/color][/size]

[img]http://img133.imageshack.us/img133/3645/desenterrariiivd8.jpg[/img]

[b]EspaÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â±ol:[/b] En este capÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­tulo la investigaciÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³n arqueolÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³gica se centra en el origen del pueblo de Israel. Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¿QuiÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©nes eran los antiguos israelitas y cÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³mo aparecieron en la regiÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³n? Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¿QuÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â© papel desempeÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â±aron los llamados Pueblos del Mar? Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¿Contribuyeron a la formaciÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³n de la naciÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³n de Israel?
El nacimiento de la escritura resulta capital para el estudio de la autorÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­a de los textos bÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­blicos. En los yacimientos de la ÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©poca se han descubierto fragmentos de cerÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¡mica que contienen distintas inscripciones. Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¿SabÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­an los israelitas leer y escribir en el siglo siete antes de Cristo?

[b]English:[/b][i] The investigation now turns to the people who put the biblical texts down on paper. Who were the original Israelites? How did they appear in the region? What part did the sudden emergence in the Levant of the Peoples of the Sea play in the birth of the Israelite nation? What can we find out about what characterized the original Israelites, their customs and beliefs; the reform which led to the writing of the Bible&#039;s fifth Book, Deuteronomy; the place of the writing in the birth, for the first time in these societies, of an authoritative text, the Bible; and the fall of Juda and the Israelites&#039; Exile in Babylon?[/i]
